ComponentDescription: An action footer is a user interface (UI) component that provides common actions in the form of pre-arranged buttons and hyperlinks, as well as dividers to segment groups of actions. Action footers are the lowest level of content within a container and can be used within the layout of a page to divide and organize content in meaningful ways. They provide the users with actions that can be associated with the content that lives within the container.
ComponentOptions:
Standard Action Footer
- Single Start Action
- Centered Action Footer
- Multiple Start and End Actions
Centerted Action Footer
- Single  Action
- Multiple Actions
Block Action Footer
- Single  Action
- Multiple Actions
TesterInfo:
David Gustafson, Senior Software Testing Engineer, David_Gustafson@epam.com
Frederick Pollnitz, Sr. User Experience Designer, C_pollnitz.frederick@cerner.com

1.1.1 Non-text Content.explanation:
Terra Action Footer is a container that would not be applicable to this criterion. 

Terra provides Consuming teams the ability to include images which would need alternative content.

Consuming teams must ensure appropriate alternate content is added to meaningful content.

1.2.1 Audio-only and Video-only (Prereco.explanation:
Product does not contain media. 

The implementing team must ensure this criterion is met if media is added.

1.2.2 Captions (Prerecorded).explanation:
Product does not contain media. 

The implementing team must ensure this criterion is met if media is added.

1.2.3 Audio Description or Media Alterna.explanation:
Product does not contain media. 

The implementing team must ensure this criterion is met if media is added.

1.3.1 Info and Relationships.explanation:
Terra Action Footer is a container that can hold interactive content. It does not create any visual relationships that must be conveyed programmatically for users to understand or use the component.

Terra does provide the ability to include interactive elements within the Action Footer.

Consuming teams must ensure that any meaningful context that is provided visually is also programmatically determined.

1.3.2 Meaningful Sequence.explanation:
Terra Action Footer is a container that would support meaningful sequence of content. The visual presentation of the native container does not convey any meaningful order. Content within the Action Footer would be read in the order of the code.

Terra provides implementing teams the ability to add content to the Action Footer in whatever order they need for a meaningful sequence. 

Consuming teams must ensure any content added to Terra Action Footer is added in a way that supports the meaningful sequence of the reading order.

1.3.3 Sensory Characteristics.explanation:
Terra does not provide any instructions within the UI. 

Consuming teams must review their content to ensure sensory characteristics are not included within any instructions. For example:
"Click on the green pencil" would require users to have both perception of color and sight.

"Listen for the beep" would require a user to hear.

"Select the star at the top of the page" would require the user to see the star and know where at the top to find it.

1.4.1 Use of Color.explanation:
Terra components do rely on color alone to convey information.

Consuming teams must ensure color is not the only method used to convey information to the user. Instead, use both color and a shape or text.

For example:
Instead of a range of color slivers to convey a status, use words to communicate the status in addition to the colors.

Instead of a single shape indicator in different colors, use different shapes in addition to color to represent different categories on a chart.

1.4.2 Audio Control.explanation:
No audio plays upon opening screens in product.

Consuming teams must ensure this criterion is met if media is added to the product.

2.1.1 Keyboard.explanation:
Terra Action Footer does not receive keyboard focus and is not actionable by itself.

Terra Action Footer supports including interactive elements within it.

Consuming teams must ensure that all interactable elements can receive focus, be interacted with, and are able to be acted upon.

2.1.2 No Keyboard Trap.explanation:
User is able to focus in and out of Terra Action Footer without encountering a keyboard trap when interactive elements are used within it.

Consuming teams must ensure no keyboard traps are introduced into code.

2.1.4 Character Key Shortcuts.explanation:
Terra Action Footer does not have any character-key (single-letter) shortcuts.

Consuming teams must ensure this criterion is met and not implement a single key shortcut without the ability to turn off, remap the key, or be available only when a component has focus.

2.2.1 Timing Adjustable.explanation: Terra Action Footer is a container. Any interactive elements placed within it should not have a time limit.

2.2.2 Pause, Stop, Hide.explanation:
Nothing autoplays or moves in application.

Consuming teams must ensure this criterion is met if media is added to the product.

2.3.1 Three Flashes or Below Threshold.explanation:
Product contains no flashing or flickering that would cause seizures or migraines.

Consuming teams must ensure this criterion is met if media is added to the product.

2.4.1 Bypass Blocks.explanation:
Terra components are independent of the page. Terra does provide other components that support methods to implement bypass blocks

Consuming teams must ensure methods are employed to meet this criterion.

2.4.2 Page Titled.explanation:
Terra Action Footer is independent of the whole page.

Consuming teams must ensure this criterion is met.

2.4.3 Focus Order.explanation:
Terra Action Footer is a container and does not receive focus itself.

Terra supports the ability to include interactive components within Action Footer and will receive focus in the order of the code. 

Consuming teams must ensure the focus order is expected and preserves page meaning. Consuming teams must also ensure not to implement a tab index value greater than zero.

2.4.4 Link Purpose (In Context).explanation:
Terra Action Footer is a container that would not be applicable to this criterion as the sample provided contains no links. 

Terra Action Footer provides the ability for Consuming teams to create links within the Action Footer. 

Consuming teams must ensure that the purpose of links are visually and programmatically available.

2.5.1 Pointer Gestures.explanation: Terra components do not require multipoint or path based gestures to operate.

2.5.2 Pointer Cancellation.explanation:
Terra Action Footer is a container that would not be applicable to this criterion because it has no interactions. 

Terra provides the ability to add interactable elements to the container. Any interactable elements used within the Action Footer would be required to meet this criterion.

Consuming teams must ensure that actions are not activated by the down action, allowing the user to cancel interactions.

2.5.3 Label in Name.explanation:
Terra Action Footer is a module that contains other components. It does not have a label.

Terra provides the ability for Consuming teams to add interactive content inside the Action Footer with a visual and programmatic label to components.

Consuming teams must ensure the programmatic label matches the visual label when interactable elements are included with this component.

2.5.4 Motion Actuation.explanation:
Terra does not provide any motion based functionality. 

If motion based functionality is implemented, Consuming teams would be responsible to ensure this requirement is met.

3.1.1 Language of Page.explanation:
Terra Action Footer is independent of language.

Consuming teams must ensure the appropriate LANG attribute value is set to ensure language of the page can be programmatically determined.

3.2.1 On Focus.explanation:
Terra Action Footer is a container of other components, and does not initiate a change of context (or anything unexpected).

Consuming teams must ensure no unexpected change of context happens when interactive elements receive focus.

3.2.2 On Input.explanation:
Terra Action Footer is a container that would not be applicable to this criterion because it is not an input. Contents within the Action Footer must meet this requirement. 

Consuming teams must ensure that nothing unexpected happens when interactive elements are incorporated into the component.

3.3.1 Error Identification.explanation:
Terra Action Footer is a container and therefore would never cause errors. Contents within the Action Footer must meet this requirement. 

Terra provides the ability to identify errors within forms.

Consuming teams must ensure error identification is provided when implementing forms.

3.3.2 Labels or Instructions.explanation:
Terra Action Footer is a container that does not require input.  

However, Terra provides the ability to include interactive content within the Action Footer.

Consuming teams must ensure labels and instructions are provided when needed to ensure users know what is expected.

4.1.1 Parsing.explanation:
Terra components are tested and validated before release to ensure proper parsing of code.

Consuming teams must ensure this criterion is met.

4.1.2 Name, Role, Value.explanation:
Name, Role, and Value does not apply to Terra Action Footer because it is not an actionable element.

Terra provides the ability to add content within action footer.
 
Consuming teams must ensure that any content inside Action Footer meets this criterion.

1.2.4 Captions (Live).explanation:
Product does not contain media. 

The implementing team must ensure this criterion is met if media is added.

1.2.5 Audio Description (Prerecorded).explanation:
Product does not contain media. 

The implementing team must ensure this criterion is met if media is added.

1.3.4 Orientation.explanation:
Terra components operate independent of orientation.

Consuming teams must ensure all components meet this requirement.

1.3.5 Identify Input Purpose.explanation: Terra components are not available to auto-population.

1.4.3 Contrast (Minimum).explanation:
Content in the library examples within Terra Action Footer meets the appropriate contrast ratios. 

Terra Action Footer provides the ability to include other actionable elements within Action Footer.

Consuming teams must ensure any content used within Terra Action Footer meets the proper contrast ratios for this criterion to be met.

1.4.4 Resize text.explanation:
Terra Action Footer supports resizing and zooming without loss of information or function.

Consuming teams must ensure content other than captions and images of text can be up to 200 percent without loss of content or functionality.

1.4.5 Images of Text.explanation:
Terra Action Footer is a container that would not be applicable to this criterion because it is not an image. 

However, Terra provides the ability to add images within Terra Action Footer. Any images used within the Action Footer must meet this requirement. 

Images of text are discouraged.

Consuming teams must ensure this criterion is met with any content used within Terra Action Footer.

1.4.10 Reflow.explanation:
Terra Action Footer supports reflow when the viewport is resized to 320x256 px without scrolling in two directions or loss of information or functionality.

Consuming teams must ensure this criterion is met.

1.4.11 Non-Text Contrast.explanation:
Terra Action Footer is a container that does not have non-text-content that conveys information to the user. The border is not required for users to understand the content it contains. 

Terra provides the ability to include non-text elements within the Terra Action Footer. Any non-text content used within the Action Footer must meet this requirement.

Consuming teams must ensure that any non-text content that conveys meaning to the user meet the 3:1 contrast ratio.

1.4.12 Text Spacing.explanation:
Terra Action Footer supports altering multiple CSS attributes without loss of function or information.

Consuming teams must ensure this criterion is met.

1.4.13 Content on Hover or Focus.explanation:
Terra Action Footer is a container of other components. The Action footer itself does not have a hover. 

Terra provides the ability on add content to action footer. Any content used within Action Footer may potentially have content on hover or focus.

Consuming teams must ensure that any content on hover or focus, other than the tool tip from the TITLE attribute, meets this criterion.

2.4.5 Multiple Ways.explanation:
Terra Action Footer is independent of the whole page.

Consuming teams must ensure this criterion is met.

2.4.6 Headings and Labels.explanation:
Terra Action Footer is a container that does not have a label or heading. However, Terra Action Footer can include actionable components which must meet this requirement.

Terra Action Footer provides the ability for teams to create a meaningful label.

Consuming teams must ensure headings and labels use text that appropriately describes the topic or purpose it represents.

2.4.7 Focus Visible.explanation:
Terra Action footer is a container and does not receive focus itself. 

Terra supports including interactive components within Action Footer.

Consuming teams must ensure visible focus is maintained on interactive elements used within the Terra Action Footer.

3.1.2 Language of Parts.explanation:
Terra Action Footer is independent of language. If Table elements are labeled with a differing language of the page being used, Terra supports the ability to accurately reflect the correct language of the table element.

Terra supports the ability to implement individual or specific language attributes on parts.

Consuming teams must ensure the appropriate LANG attribute value is applied, if/where applicable, to ensure any content not of the same language of the page can be programmatically understood as a the correct language.

3.2.3 Consistent Navigation.explanation:
Terra Action Footer is independent of the whole page.

Consuming teams must ensure when navigation is used, that it remains consistent from page to page.

3.2.4 Consistent Identification.explanation:
Terra Action Footer is only a container that does not have any inherent functionality. 

Terra supports the ability to add buttons and links within the Action Footer.

Consuming teams must ensure to consistently identify elements within the Action Footer used for the same functionality.

3.3.3 Error Suggestion.explanation:
Terra Action Footer is a container that would not be applicable to this criterion because the examples given in the Terra library do not contain form elements which could generate an error. 

However, Terra provides the ability to include applicable content within the Action Footer which must meet this requirement. 

Terra provides the ability to include error suggestion when forms are validated.

Consuming teams must ensure error suggestion is provided when implementing forms.

3.3.4 Error Prevention (Legal, Financial.explanation:
Terra Action Footer is a container that is independent of forms and validation. Contents within the Action Footer that drive form validation must meet this requirement. 

It is incumbent upon consuming teams to make sure that this requirement is met when forms are provided within a product.

4.1.3 Status Messages.explanation:
Terra Action Footer contains no status message.

Terra provides the ability for Consuming teams to add the programmatically knowable status messages. 

Consuming teams must ensure any status messages are implemented correctly to ensure programmatic availability.

302.1 Without Vision.explanation:
Terra Action Footer does not receive keyboard focus and is not actionable by itself.

Terra Action Footer supports including interactive elements within it.

Consuming teams must ensure that all interactable elements can receive focus, be interacted with, and are able to be acted upon.

302.2 With Limited Vision.explanation:
Terra Action Footer is available for alternative mode of operation and responsively resize to 400%.

Consuming teams must ensure this criterion is met.

302.3 Without Perception of Color.explanation:
Terra components do not require perception of color to operate. 

Consuming teams must ensure color alone is not the only method of conveying information.

302.4 Without Hearing.explanation:
This component can be used to create a meaningful experience for someone who is deaf because the product doesn't have any sound. 

Consuming teams must ensure this criterion is met if audio is added to the component.

302.5 With Limited Hearing.explanation:
This component can be used to create a meaningful experience for someone who is hard of hearing because the product doesn't have any sound. 

Consuming teams must ensure this criterion is met if audio is added to the component.

302.6 Without Speech.explanation: This component can be used to create a meaningful experience for someone who has a speech impediment or lack of speech because the product doesn't require speech.

302.7 With Limited Manipulation.explanation:
Terra Action Footer does not receive keyboard focus and is not actionable by itself.

However, Terra Action Footer supports including interactive elements within it which can be used to create a meaningful experience for people with limited manipulation because they provide, within the container, standard size click targets and do not require fine motor skills or simultaneous keyboard commands.

Consuming teams must ensure this criterion is met.

302.8 With Limited Reach and Strength.explanation:
Terra Action Footer does not receive keyboard focus and is not actionable by itself.

However, Terra Action Footer supports including interactive elements within it which can be used to create a meaningful experience for people with limited reach and strength because elements within the container support assistive technology and do not rely on a user's reach or specific strength to operate.

Consuming teams must ensure this criterion is met.

302.9 With Limited Language, Cognitive,.explanation:
Terra Action Footer does not receive keyboard focus and is not actionable by itself.

However, Terra Action Footer supports including interactive elements within it which can be used to create a meaningful experience for people with limited language, cognitive, and learning abilities when consuming teams implement elements within the container with proper labels, instructions, and following best practice.

Consuming teams must ensure this criterion is met.

4.2.1 Usage without vision.explanation:
Terra Action Footer does not receive keyboard focus and is not actionable by itself.

Terra Action Footer supports including interactive elements within it.

Consuming teams must ensure that all interactable elements can receive focus, be interacted with, and are able to be acted upon.

4.2.2 Usage with limited vision.explanation:
Terra Action Footer is available for alternative mode of operation and responsively resize to 400%.

Consuming teams must ensure this criterion is met.

4.2.3 Usage without perception of colour.explanation:
Terra components do not require perception of color to operate. 

Consuming teams must ensure color alone is not the only method of conveying information.

4.2.4 Usage without hearing.explanation:
This component can be used to create a meaningful experience for someone who is deaf because the product doesn't have any sound. 

Consuming teams must ensure this criterion is met if audio is added to the component.

4.2.5 Usage with limited hearing.explanation:
This component can be used to create a meaningful experience for someone who is hard of hearing because the product doesn't have any sound. 

Consuming teams must ensure this criterion is met if audio is added to the component.

4.2.6 Usage without vocal capability.explanation: This component can be used to create a meaningful experience for someone who has a speech impediment or lack of speech because the product doesn't require speech.

4.2.7 Usage with limited manipulation or.explanation:
Terra Action Footer does not receive keyboard focus and is not actionable by itself.

However, Terra Action Footer supports including interactive elements within it which can be used to create a meaningful experience for people with limited manipulation because they provide, within the container, standard size click targets and do not require fine motor skills or simultaneous keyboard commands.

Consuming teams must ensure this criterion is met.

4.2.8 Usage with limited reach.explanation:
Terra Action Footer does not receive keyboard focus and is not actionable by itself.

However, Terra Action Footer supports including interactive elements within it which can be used to create a meaningful experience for people with limited reach and strength because elements within the container support assistive technology and do not rely on a user's reach or specific strength to operate.

Consuming teams must ensure this criterion is met.

4.2.9 Minimize photosensitive seizure tr.explanation:
Product contains no flashing or flickering that would cause seizures or migraines.

Consuming teams must ensure this criterion is met if media is added to the product.

4.2.10 Usage with limited cognition.explanation:
Terra Action Footer does not receive keyboard focus and is not actionable by itself.

However, Terra Action Footer supports including interactive elements within it which can be used to create a meaningful experience for people with limited language, cognitive, and learning abilities when consuming teams implement elements within the container with proper labels, instructions, and following best practice.

Consuming teams must ensure this criterion is met.

4.2.11 Privacy.explanation:
Terra components are independent of the user. 

Consuming teams must ensure this criterion is met.
